definition: to weigh in the hand/to estimate
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to weigh in the hand/to consider/to ponder

sentences.english: It's not working. We need an army of climate outlaws.
sentences.chinese: 它不掂，我们需要一队军队的气候亡命之徒。

sentences.english: At this point Shasta got up and tiptoed away.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔听到这儿便站起身来，掂着脚走开了。

sentences.english: Pick up, Dian the Dian is actually a weight of book.
sentences.chinese: 拿起来，掂了掂，的确是一本书的重量。

sentences.english: Pick up, Dian the Dian is actually a weight of book.
sentences.chinese: 拿起来，掂了掂，的确是一本书的重量。

sentences.english: From the context of the text I find the next pretext for selling the textile.
sentences.chinese: 我从课文的前后关系中找到卖纺织品掂一个借口。

sentences.english: He weighed the stone in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他把石头拿在手上掂了掂重量。

sentences.english: He weighed the stone in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他把石头拿在手上掂了掂重量。

sentences.english: Being a gastronome my uncle is well acquainted with the best restaurants in the city.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个美食者，我舅舅知掂镶个城市最好的餐馆。

sentences.english: How to analyze—and create—artworks made out of other artworks.
sentences.chinese: 怎样分析并创造脱胎于其它艺术品掂煺术品。

sentences.english: Absurdly I held it and weighed it in my hand, to give myself courage.
sentences.chinese: 我可笑地拿起枪，在手里掂掂，替自己壮胆。

sentences.english: Absurdly I held it and weighed it in my hand, to give myself courage.
sentences.chinese: 我可笑地拿起枪，在手里掂掂，替自己壮胆。

sentences.english: Oh and some clothes to wear something light and cool.
sentences.chinese: 哦，还有些清凉轻质掂炻服。

sentences.english: He hefted the box and said it was not too heavy.
sentences.chinese: 他掂了掂那个箱子说不算太重。

sentences.english: He hefted the box and said it was not too heavy.
sentences.chinese: 他掂了掂那个箱子说不算太重。

sentences.english: United Kingdom consists of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 陋合王国陨大不列掂和辈爱尔兰组成。

sentences.english: If you insist I will comply with your request.
sentences.chinese: 如果你坚持，我们会遵照你掂飒求。

definition: to weigh in the hand/to consider/to ponder
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
